reviews.text: We exchanged our timeshare week through Interval International. Marriott recently changed to a points system, so maybe that's why we got a 2 bedroom/2 bath condo when we only own a one bedroom through Club Navigo (Island One). We enjoyed the upgrade! We read all the mixed reviews. When we arrived we asked for an ocean view room, but not in the Kingfisher building as suggested in a Trip Advisor review. The clerk was shocked that there were any negative things, but said the Marriott guests that are owners actually REQUEST the Kingfisher building! She said she could give us an ocean view upgrade: We could see the Atlantic from our room AND the inlet to the intercostal/ lagoon waterways and see all the boats going by. We fell in love with the view. The rooms are very spacious. It IS due for a remodel/update, but the aesthetics were not a deal breaker. This building looks different from the other 3 and is set apart by a large private pink condo/apartment building. So, if you have small kids you DON"T want to stay there as there is a lot of walking to get to the activities held at the other pools and buildings. We actually LIKED that is was farther away and enjoyed the exercise. The resort is very fitness oriented as they offer daily stretching classes and water aerobics. I tried the water aerobics for the first time and Loved it! Zumba is twice a week. I tried this for the first time, too and loved it. When rain cancels an outdoor activity it's usually relocated or changed to an indoor building. I loved the changing beach on my twice daily walks. Plenty of shells for those that like that. I collect sea glass and brought home a lot of pieces. There are a lot of onsite activities that are free or low cost like games, crafts and video games. they have Wii, X-Box and Atari! The staff was friendly, welcoming and professional. The grounds were immaculate and the pools and spas were well maintained.
reviews.title: Great timeshare exchange

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a week here on a Interval International - Diamond Resorts exchange. The points cost was very good value. We were in the Kingfish building which is remote from the reception and main activity area, however on the plus side it was never too crowded around our pool area. The room had a partial sea view and was up to "Marriot" standard, that is in my opinion very good, well appointed and very clean. If you wanted to use the beach then you either took your own chairs and parasol or you could rent those placed on the beach by a local company. we prefer the pool side anyway as a rule so not a problem. The on site market stocked the basics, the nearest 7 - 11 was about a half mile walk up the road as was a couple of very "lively" bar/ restaurants. There is a Publix just over the bridge to do a serious food shop. In order to find a decent restaurant you had to get in the car and drive off Singer island and look around the shopping areas. The huge and diverse Garden Mall is just a few miles away, there is also a good selection of shops and eateries at the Oakbrook shopping area. Overall I would happily return to this resort.
reviews.title: Great Beach Side Location. Needs a decent restaurant on site.

reviews.text: This is a beautiful resort. Oceanfront, grounds are beautiful. We had a 3 bedroom villa that was oceanfront with 3 baths, beautiful décor. We stayed in the Pompano Building, which some reviews suggest was "outdated and old". Our villa was outstanding. This resort is next to the Port of Palm Beach so the ships, boats, yachts in and out of the harbor were great to watch. I was pleasantly surprised to find how great this actually was. Our first visit to this Marriott Vacation Club and we'd all go again ! Great staff, great service !
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort
Great resort at a great location
reviews.text: Had a 2 BR here for a week on a timeshare exchange and loved it. Nice quiet town and an incredible location on the sand where the Palm Beach inlet meets the ocean. Huge resort spread over 4 buildings with hundreds of feet of beach. Uncrowded beach and you watch the boats coming in and out of the inlet. Great amenities for all ages on site. The only possible negative is that the rooms could use some updated cabinets and flooring. Love it here and will stay as often as possible

reviews.title: Fantastic resort and beach location
reviews.text: We came here for our one year anniversary. The area surrounding the strip of resorts is a little ghetto, but we felt safe the entire time. Staff and service were friendly and accommodating. Our 4th floor ocean view suite was clean, and offered beautiful views. The pool area had good music, and activities for kids and adults on-going throughtout the afternoons. We would definitely come back again to stay&play.

We are currently at this resort and it gone DOWN HILL since our last visit. The check in girl was beyond rude. The beach is NASTY and they are making no attempt to clean it up! the rooms need to be re-cleaned. crazy disappontment! We are platinum Marriott members
reviews.title: If you want hospitality and service, don't go here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the front desk girl said this is Marriott vacation club we don't care about platinum here. Currently we are trying to move locations even though we will lose money because we pre-paid. I'm sure the manager we talked to will pop up with a patronizing reply to this review but I'm warning you, if you like hospitable service, like you would expect from a Marriott go down the beach to the Singer Island Marriott and Spa, that's what we are doing!
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort -- Would love to visit again

reviews.text: We arrived the Saturday before Mother's Day. I booked the place using an Interval International timeshare exchange. Honestly, after several mediocre experiences with RCI exchanges, I was not sure how this would turn out. There were mixed reviews here and other places on the web. I was not disappointed at all. Check-in process was very smooth. It took less than 5 minutes! Extremely grateful after a 7-8 hour drive. We were assigned a two bedroom villa on the first floor of the Pompano building. I knew before the trip that the lower floors didn't have a view of the ocean...but that wasn't really important to me. For those people fussing about the view...the property makes their policy of reserving higher floor units for OWNERS very clear...that's right..people who buy into the Marriott Vacation Club can have that great view...
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moving right along...the villa was great. Parking was abundant..and we even snagged two spots under the building. There are two elevators in the building (which is handy when lots of people are checking out). The parking areas and elevators are secured by RFID card access. The hallways were well lit and clean. Our villa had a lockout option and with separate entrance (this is just one of the efficiency suites connected to a larger suite by a locking door similar to a hotel room) so we could all come and go as we pleased without disturbing anyone. There were plenty of pots, pans and dishes as well as towels (which always seems to be a problem) and a washer/dryer stacked unit. The master suite had a really nice two person spa tub and a huge shower as well. Sliding glass doors exit to a balcony connected to the living room. I can't say much about the other room...I didn't spend any time in there, but the other couple that was with us seemed to enjoy it thoroughly.
reviews.title: A typically outstanding Marriott resort with some housekeeping issues.

reviews.text: After we got settled we decided to take a trip down to the pool bar and grab a bite to eat. It was closing but we were served anyway and the food was pretty decent for bar fare. Fish tacos,chicken quesadilla and blackened mahi sandwich were a few of the items on the menu. Drinks were all about 10 bucks but this is to be expected at a resort. My only complaint about "On the Rocks" is that they didn't accept cash. Credit or room charge only...but I survived. Not a bad experience to top of a really long day traveling.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently 4 nights at this hotel - our room was a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom with 1 full sized kitchen, 1 smaller kitchen and a sitting/dining area. We are in the Dolphin Building and it was pretty we taken care of in terms of every day cleanliness. The carpet was a bit stained here and there but nothing that would make you weary of the place being cared for. All the staff I came into contact with were friendly and courteous and the grounds were beautiful with easy access to a great beach.
reviews.title: Pretty nice as long as the sun shines!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried all 3 pools and both hot tub/spas and all of them were cleaned frequently. Just a tip if cold weather is trying to talk you out of swimming, try the Kingfisher pool (we were told all 3 were 'heated' but this one was significantly more comfortable that the others when it was overcast). The cocktails at the Tiki Bar were nice but definitely on the expensive side.
reviews.title: Beautiful Spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the weather during our trip was windy/raining/cool most of the time and it's fair to say that there is next to nothing to occupy yourself in this area unless you like to shop constantly, eat constantly or are a small child, so bear this in mind if you're chancing an off season deal.
reviews.title: Nice vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, would stay again but wouldn't be my first choice as an overall destination.
reviews.title: Great Time at Marriott's Ocean Pointe

reviews.text: My husband and I just spent our 10-year anniversary at this beautiful resort, and we couldn't have been more pleased! We have stayed at Marriott timeshares in Orlando, Phoenix, and Aruba, and this one was by far our favorite. The resort is clean and well-kept, and the pools, kids' area, bar, bathrooms, Marketplace, etc. are all centrally located, and very convenient no matter which building you are staying in. The parking is free, which was an added bonus. Beware if you are a smoker. The resort is smoke-free, so you are not even permitted to smoke on your balcony. There are a few designated smoking areas, but that's it. We could not get enough of the beach here. The water is crystal clear, and we had a great time bobbing in the waves. The resort is the last one on the strip, so it doesn't get as much foot traffic as I imagine the resorts further down do, which makes it really enjoyable, and not overly crowded. If you don't have chairs of your own, you will need to pay to rent lounge chairs and an umbrella (shade is a must on this beach or you will roast). We paid $100 for the week, and it was the best investment we made. The chairs are adjustable, our spot was right near the water, and the guys that run the service come around a few tmes a day to see if you need your umbrella moved to provide more shade. They are highly attentive, and also a great source of info for recommendations for places to eat, and things to do in the area. We were even lucky enough to see a giant sea turtle laying her eggs on the beach one night when we went for a moon-lit walk! I really can't say enough about this resort. It is just spectacular. And if you have children, it's a great spot. They have a kiddie pool, a sprinkler park, and a whole area of games...minigolf, shuffleboard, bocce, corn hole, etc. And the resort offers a variety of daily activites for kids and families. You can even rent boogie boards and bikes right there at the resort. Book a few nights here...you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Family Spot

reviews.text: We came here for a week with our 11 month old daughter and the resort has all the conveniences for a family stay. The beach and pools are just downstairs, there's a playground with lots of fun water fountains. The Publix supermarket is a short drive away. The rooms were good, it's nothing to write home about but it was sufficient and all the appliances worked. They provided a pack n play, with a little plastic gummy bear toy (for our little one who loved it), a high chair (which is always so helpful). Overall, we recommend it for families.
reviews.title: An excellent family resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great week - second time to visit. Give a high floor, ocean view studio - more than adequate for our needs. Great stay on beach, pool and surrounding area. Great restaurants in the area - breakfast just along the street.
reviews.title: Week stay as a swap from my home Marriott property

reviews.text: This resort is fantastic! It's got wonderful amenities, activities center for kids is awesome, pools (all 4 I believe) are great!
reviews.title: Fab fab fab!!!

reviews.text: The units are really nice, modern, and clean. Our building was a couple buildings away from the other 3 or 4. We were a little far from the activities center but the walk wasn't too bad ( I like the exercise but not so fun in a thunderstorm).
reviews.title: Ok... could be better

reviews.text: Our view of the beach and ocean was stunning. My parents had a corner unit and a view of an intercostal(?) and the ocean as well. It was so fun watching all the boats and yachts go out to sea! Very nice balconies as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort in Cute Little Town
